items.title: OnePlus set to unveil OnePlus 15 flagship lineup this month, and here are the colors
items.summary: The OnePlus 15 and OnePlus Ace 6 (potentially rebranded into the OnePlus 15R) are all set to launch in China in ten days.
items.body: TL;DR The OnePlus 15 and OnePlus Ace 6 are set to launch in China on October 27. The OnePlus 15 will feature the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5, a 165Hz display, and be available in three colors. The OnePlus Ace 6 is widely expected to be rebranded as the OnePlus 15R for international markets. Both phones are rumored to launch internationally on November 13, 2025. Weâ€™re already on our way to the next generation of Android flagships , sporting the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 SoC . OnePlus doesnâ€™t intend to be left behind, and the company has now confirmed that the OnePlus 15 will launch this month alongside its sub-flagship offering. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: England's Wood 'quietly confident' for Ashes opener
items.summary: England fast bowler Mark Wood says he is "quietly confident" of being fit for the first Test of the Ashes series in Australia.

items.title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜The Life Of A Showgirlâ€™ Dazzles on ARIAÂ Charts
items.summary: Swift notches another chart double in Australia.
items.body: Taylor Swiftâ€™s The Life Of A Showgirl (via Republic/Universal) isnâ€™t moving from the spotlight on the ARIA Charts. After snagging the entire top 12 of the national singles chart last week, Taylor dominates once again with eight of the top 10, led by The Fate Of Ophelia which locks up the top spot for a second week. Meanwhile, The Life Of A Showgirl enters a second week at No. 1 on the ARIA Albums Chart , as Swift completes another chart double. Across her career, Swift has accumulated 70 weeks on top of the national albums survey, according to ARIA, an accomplishment that has origins dating back in 2010 with Speak Now , which spent one week at the top. The top new release on the latest ARIA Albums Chart, published Friday, Oct. 17, is Pete Murray â€™s independently-released Longing (CMI), at No. 5. Longing is the Queensland singer and songwriterâ€™s seventh full-length studio album and first in eight years, three of which reached No. 1 ( Feeler in 2003, See The Sun in 2005, Summer At Eureka in 2008). Another artist from the Sunshine State, Gold Coast singer, songwriter and producer Lyric, bags a debut top 10 with her second EP, The Art Of Falling First (G.Y.R.O.). Itâ€™s new at No. 9, anâ€¦

items.title: Can you trust any Liverpool assets? The FPL talking point
items.summary: Following back-to-back defeats for Liverpool, is it time to take their players out of your Fantasy Premier League team or do you keep faith with them?

items.summary: Grand Slam winner Naomi Osaka withdraws from the Japan Open through injury as tennis players continue to struggle.

items.title: St John's seek to end 52 years of hurt in Antrim
items.summary: St John's have endured many disappointments over the past 10 years, but on Sunday they get the opportunity to run out on Antrim hurling final day for the first time since 1994 when they take on Loughgiel.

items.summary: Nick Woltemade has become used to proving people wrong, but what makes the Newcastle striker such a unique talent?

items.title: Bengals upset Steelers with dramatic late win
items.summary: Evan McPherson's field goal with seven seconds left gives the Cincinnati Bengals a dramatic 33-31 victory against the Pittsburgh Steelers.

items.title: Former NBA MVP Westbrook joins Sacramento Kings
items.summary: Former NBA Most Valuable Player Russell Westbrook signs for the Sacramento Kings ahead of his 18th season.

items.title: The story behind Exeter's nine-fingered photo tradition
items.summary: BBC Sport examines the origins of a tradition Exeter players have done for every team photo for two decades.

items.title: All Time Low Lift Off With â€˜Everyoneâ€™s Talking!â€™: Stream ItÂ Now
items.summary: "Everyoneâ€™s Talking!" is the 10th full-length studio effort from the Maryland quartet.
items.body: All Time Low notch up double digits with Everyoneâ€™s Talking!, which arrives today, Oct. 17, through the alternative rock veteransâ€™ own label Basement Noise Records. Everyoneâ€™s Talking! is the 10 th full-length studio LP from the Maryland quartet, comprising Alex Gaskarth, Jack Barakat, Rian Dawson and Zack Merrick, and features the previously-released â€œSugar,â€ a collaboration with Grammy Award winning singer and songwriter JoJo, and the first single â€œSuckerpunch.â€ All Time Low have landed 10 titles on the Billboard 200 chart, including five top 10 appearances. All told, the rockers have racked up 5 billion career streams, and led Billboard â€™s Alternative Airplay chart with â€œSleepwalkingâ€ (in 2023) and â€œMonsters,â€ featuring blackbear , the latter logging 18 weeks at the summit in 2020-21. All Time Low has been roadtesting new material on their 30-plus-date Everyone’s Talking! Tour , which kicked off earlier this month and endured a hiccup earlier this week when the band skipped shows at Red Rocks and Seattle when frontman Gaskarth was sidelined with a throat infection. Gaskarth has been cleared to continue on the tour, reads a statement (though heâ€™s being â€œextremely mindful oâ€¦

items.title: Tame Impala Drops â€˜Deadbeatâ€™ Album: Stream ItÂ Now
items.summary: "Deadbeat" is the Australian production maestroâ€™s first Tame Impala album in five years.
items.body: Kevin Parker winds back the clock, tunes up the dancefloor and reminds us to get our arms out wide (or up high) on Deadbeat , Tame Impala â€™s fifth and latest full-length studio album. Dropping at midnight, Oct. 17, Deadbeat is the production maestroâ€™s first Tame Impala album in five years, and the first through the Sony Music network, by way of a new deal with Columbia Records . As previously reported, Deadbeat is inspired by the â€œbush doofâ€ culture of Parkerâ€™s native Western Australia rave scene, a moment in time impressively captured on its first release, â€œEnd of Summerâ€. Parker will assemble his touring band for a raft of newly-announced  pan-European and U.K. concerts  next year, starting April 4 at Super Bock Arena in Porto, Portugal and wrapping up May 13 at 3Arena in Dublin, Ireland. Heâ€™ll get matters underway next when, when The  Deadbeat Tour  kicks off its North America run with a show Oct. 27 at Brooklynâ€™s Barclays Center. Deadbeat drops half a decade after  The Slow Rush , from February 2020, a record that went to No. 1 on Australiaâ€™s ARIA Chart, and earned career peak positions on the Billboard 200 and Official U.K. Albums Chart UK, both at Noâ€¦

items.title: Ty Dolla $ign Shows Us Whoâ€™s Boss on â€˜Tycoonâ€™ Album: Stream ItÂ Now
items.summary: "It came from a Japanese word 'tycoon,' which means 'great lord.' Itâ€™s the same thing â€” great boss, the best at your craft," Ty Dolla $ign told Billboard in an interview about 'Tycoon.'
items.body: Ty Dolla $ign dropped his fourth studio album Tycoon on Friday (Oct. 17) via Atlantic Records. “A tycoon is a boss. It came from a Japanese word ‘tycoon,’ which means ‘great lord.’ Itâ€™s the same thing â€” great boss, the best at your craft. The top of your game, right?” he told Billboard in a new interview. “Thatâ€™s what I feel like Iâ€™ve reached. Thereâ€™s still heights I wanna reach, thereâ€™s still places I wanna go, thereâ€™s still more goals I have, but Iâ€™m there. Iâ€™m one of the biggest artists in the game.” He released three singles prior to the project: the Wayne Wonder -sampling “All In,” “Smile Body Pretty Face,” featuring Kodak Black and YG , and “Show Me Love,” featuring Tory Lanez . Related Ty Dolla $ign Explains New Album Name ‘Tycoon’: ‘I’m One of the Biggest Artists in the Game’ Ty Dolla $ign and Shawn Barron Honored at Billboardâ€™s Future of Music & Money Event Ty Dolla $ign Says “R&B Is Making a Comeback,” His Song of the Summer is Leon Thomas’ “Mutt” & More| R&B/Hip-Hop Power Players 2025 Tycoon comes â€¦

items.title: Sabrina Carpenter Confesses Her â€˜Greatest Fearâ€™ in â€˜SNLâ€™ Promos â€” And Itâ€™s Exactly the Same as Marcello Hernandezâ€™s
items.summary: This will mark the pop star's first time hosting, after performing on a 2024 episode & appearing on the SNL50 special.
items.body: This weekend, Sabrina Carpenter will return to the Saturday Night Live stage — but this time, she’ll be hosting. In new promos for her double duty as host and musical guest on Saturday’s show, Carpenter scoffs when castmember Marcello Hernandez asks if she’s “scared to host.” “Me? I perform in front of thousands of screaming fans every night,” Carpenter replies casually. Related Watch Sabrina Carpenter Channel (a Slightly More Delusional) Carrie Bradshaw in ‘SNL’ Promo We’ll Make This Short ‘n Sweet: Sabrina Carpenter Is Up for an Anthem Award How Dua Lipa, Chappell Roan & Sabrina Carpenter Are Maximizing Their Tours With Smart Pop Tactics “So youâ€™re not scared?” Hernandez asks, to which Carpenter responds, “No. Iâ€™m terrified . But not of hosting. Deep down, my greatest fear isâ€¦” At this point, Carpenter and Hernandez share their identical greatest fear in unison: ” …My dentist grows a really long beard and during the appointment it tickles my chest.” The pair look at each other stunned and just walk away. Elsewhere in the promos, Carpenter and Hernandez â€¦

items.title: Ace Frehleyâ€™s Biggest Billboard Hits, With KISS &Â Beyond
items.summary: Frehley rocked on the charts with smashes like "Rock and Roll All Nite (Live)," "Shout It Out Loud" & "New York Groove."
items.body: The late Ace Frehley ‘s history on the Billboard Hot 100 chart is stacked with iconic rock smashes like â€œBeth,â€ â€œRock and Roll All Nite (Live)â€ and â€œShout It Out Loud,” all from his work as a founding member of the rock band KISS , in addition to his own late 1970s solo smash “New York Groove.” After KISS formed in 1973 with Peter Criss, Frehley, Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley, the band would begin its Billboard chart takeover in April 1974, when its self-titled debut album hit the Billboard 200 , while the singleâ€™ â€œKissinâ€™ Timeâ€ arrived on the Hot 100 the following month. Related Ace Frehley, KISS Co-Founder & Guitar Hero, Dies at 74 Before Frehley departed KISS in the early 1980s, the band had racked up an impressive collection of hits on the Hot 100, including top 40-charting singles like “Rock and Roll All Nite (Live)” (a No. 12 hit in 1976), “Shout It Out Loud” (No. 31 in 1976), the ballad “Beth” (No. 7 in 1976), “Hard Luck Woman” (No. 15 in 1977) and the disco-flavored “I Was Made for Lovin’ You” (No. 11 in 1979). (Frehley would famously reunite with KISS in 1996 for a reunion tâ€¦

items.title: Temu: MF Doom Estateâ€™s â€˜Inflammatoryâ€™ Counterfeit Merch Lawsuit Has a â€˜Fundamental Problemâ€™
items.summary: The e-commerce giant claims itâ€™s just a hosting site for independent sellers.
items.body: Temu wants to dismiss a lawsuit over counterfeit MF Doom merchandise brought by the late hip-hop legendâ€™s estate, arguing in a new court filing that itâ€™s not responsible for the actions of independent Chinese sellers who use the e-commerce site. Gas Drawls LLC, which manages the estate of MF Doom (Daniel Dumile), filed suit in August, accusing Temu of selling dozens of knock-off t-shirts, hats, posters and other merchandise displaying the deceased rapperâ€™s name and signature mask. Temuâ€™s attorneys have now responded with a court filing that calls the case legally defective. Related MF Doom Estate Sues Temu for Selling Knock-Off Merch: ‘One of the Most Unethical Companies’ Solange Appointed First Scholar-in-Residence at USC Thornton School of Music Sia's Estranged Husband Wants $260,000 Per Month to Maintain 'Upper-Class Lifestyle' â€œGas Drawlsâ€™ complaint suffers from a fundamental problem: it fails to plead any plausible facts supporting its conclusory allegation that Temu â€” rather than independent third-party sellers â€” made, sold and shipped the allegedly infringing products,â€ write Temuâ€™s lawyers from the firm Knobbe Martens in the Thursday (Oct. 16) fiâ€¦

items.title: â€˜Godspeed, Aceâ€™: Ace Frehley Mourned by KISS Bandmate Gene Simmons, Bret Michaels, Tom Morello, Pearl Jam &Â More
items.summary: The rocker died at age 74 on Thursday.
items.body: Founding KISS guitarist Ace Frehley died Thursday (Oct. 16) at age 74 after sustaining injuries suffered during a fall last month. Frehleyâ€™s family issued a statement announcing the guitarist’s death, saying in part: â€œWe are completely devastated and heartbroken. In his last moments, we were fortunate enough to have been able to surround him with loving, caring, peaceful words, thoughts, prayers and intentions as he left this earth. … Reflecting on all of his incredible life achievements, Aceâ€™s memory will continue to live on forever!â€ Related Ace Frehley, KISS Co-Founder & Guitar Hero, Dies at 74 Ace Frehley of KISS Will Become Only the Third Person to Receive a Posthumous Kennedy Center Honor Usher Hopping on Remix of Chris Brown & Bryson Tiller's 'It Depends': Here's When It Arrives Frehley’s fellow rockers were also heartbroken when the news broke, coming out in droves on social media to share their love and condolences for the late musician and his family. The guitarist’s onetime KISS bandmate and fellow co-founder Gene Simmons posted on X, writing, “Our hearts are broken. Ace has passed on. No one can touch â€¦

items.title: Brooklyn Mirage Set for Demolition Following Avant GardnerÂ Bankruptcy
items.summary: According to public records, the 32,000 square-foot nightclub that became known as a prime venue for electronic acts will be torn down.
items.body: Brooklyn Mirage â€” the 32,000-square-foot open-air nightclub that has helped define Brooklynâ€™s nightlife since 2017 â€” is set to be torn down, according to new filings with New York Cityâ€™s Department of Buildings. Public records show that Avant Gardner LLC, the company behind the venue complex, submitted a permit application on Tuesday (Oct. 14) seeking approval to demolish the Mirage. The two other venues at the Avant Gardner complex, Kings Hall and the Great Hall, are set to remain open through December. Related Brooklyn Mirage Operator Avant Gardner Files For Voluntary Chapter 11 Bankruptcy: ‘The Most Viable Path Forward’ Solange Appointed First Scholar-in-Residence at USC Thornton School of Music Sia's Estranged Husband Wants $260,000 Per Month to Maintain 'Upper-Class Lifestyle' The filing lists a $1.5 million budget for the demolition project and names H&O Engineering as the contractor. It remains unclear when demolition will begin, but filings indicate the project will be a straightforward teardown. Opened in 2017, the Mirage quickly became one of the most coveted venues for touring DJs and electronic acts, earning recognition from DJ Mag aâ€¦

items.title: Heading home? Google Maps might tell you how long itâ€™ll take before you even ask
items.summary: You know the way to your place, but this change would let you get a sense of how long the drive will take at a glance.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A user noticed Google Maps showing a live travel time in the Home chip below the search bar. The chip appears when youâ€™re not at home, but this is the first time weâ€™ve seen it display a travel time. It could help you keep in mind when to start driving when you know the route but not the traffic situation. Google Maps looks set to make it even simpler to keep track of how far you are from home. At least one user has spotted that the app now shows your estimated travel time directly in the Home chip below the search bar, potentially avoiding the need to open the route preview or start navigation.

items.title: Man Utd set fee for Fernandes - Friday gossip
items.summary: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes interests Bayern Munich, Liverpool eye Nico Schlotterbeck and Nico Williams, while Barcelona weigh up move for Dusan Vlahovic

items.title: Save a whopping $520 on the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 with 512GB!
items.summary: This is still the best deal we've seen on the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7!
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 deals can get pretty good, but you have to be ready to catch them when they come. Now is one of those times! You can get Samsungâ€™s foldable phone for just $1,599.99, and thatâ€™s for the upgraded 512GB model. Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 with 512GB for just $1,599.99 ($520 off)

items.title: Talk of Horner to Ferrari distracting - Hamilton
items.summary: Lewis Hamilton says a report that Ferrari are considering Christian Horner as their future team principal is "distracting".

items.title: Nest speakers start showing some new color â€” is Gemini to thank?
items.summary: Multicolor light effects have just started appearing up on Nest speakers, right in time for the Gemini preview.
items.body: TL;DR Nest speakers are getting a Gemini overhaul, with early access beginning this month. Nest speakers have featured a four-light display thatâ€™s so far been mostly white. Users are now sharing reports of those lights changing to a multi-colored rainbow. Nest speakers are in the middle of a big change right now, and its name is Gemini. Back at the start of the month, Google didnâ€™t just introduce the upcoming Google Home Speaker , but confirmed that early access previews of Gemini on existing Nest speaker hardware would commence later in October. As we start getting into the back half of the month, users are beginning to share the colorful new look theyâ€™ve spotted for their hardware. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: The Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 update has gone MIA
items.summary: The update has a bug that causes the SystemUI to crash.
items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Google recently released Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 for eligible Pixel devices. Now, it appears the tech giant may have pulled the update. The reason could be related to bootlooping issues caused by desktop mode. Yesterday, Google released the third and final beta of Android 16 QPR2 for eligible Pixel devices. This update resolves several issues, such as home screen shortcuts appearing as gray circles, selected themes not being applied on the first attempt, and Google Play System updates failing to install. If you waited on installing Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 , it looks like youâ€™ll have to continue waiting. Google may have pulled the update. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Verizon-owned Total Wireless now has a free plan, though there are a few catches
items.summary: Partnerining with Lifeline, Total now has a totally free plan available only in California.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Total Wireless, a Verizon Value brand, is launching a free phone plan available only in California at first. The offer is limited to customers who qualify for the government Lifeline assistance program. The plan includes unlimited talk, text, and 6GB of high-speed data, with an $11 upgrade option for unlimited data. While Verizon is best known for its own network and services, its Value brands have become increasingly popular as well. This includes Total Wireless, a premium prepaid brand that offers limited in-store support, free streaming services on select plans, and plenty of other features that help it compare favorably to postpaid options. While its plans normally start around $40, thereâ€™s about to be a much more affordable option â€” one that will cost you nothing. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Save $100 on the Bose QuietComfort Ultra, amazing ANC headphones
items.summary: Silence all the noise with these stunning headphones.
items.body: Credit: SoundGuys.com There are plenty of new and exciting headphones around, but if you care most about noise canceling, the Bose QuietComfort Ultra are still among our favorite headphones. Thereâ€™s a really nice deal on these right now! If you like blue, you can save a whole $100 on them. Buy the Bose QuietComfort Ultra in Lunar Blue for just $329 ($100 off)

items.title: Gemini can basically use Google Sheets for you now
items.summary: Google says this will 'save valuable time in your workday,' so you can... do more spreadsheets, probably?
items.body: TL;DR Gemini can now do more intricate work inside Google Sheets. You can now request complex, multi-stage edits in a single prompt. This upgraded functionality is available now on qualifying accounts. Last month, Google Sheets picked up additional Gemini functionality , gaining the ability call on Googleâ€™s AI to do things like explain how formulas work and automatically correct errors in formatting. Today, Googleâ€™s announced that Gemini can now do even more in Sheets, carrying out increasingly complex tasks on your behalf. In a blog post, Google has shared that new Gemini integration in Sheets can automate actions that involve multiple discrete steps. You can now make longer, more complicated Gemini requests in Sheets to, for example, add a new column that populates with a formula dealing with inputs you define, or to add, delete, or rearrange columns, rows, and cells however you see fit.

items.title: Avoid messy cables for a mere $4.99!
items.summary: Cable management makes all the difference!
items.body: Credit: Canisflax via Amazon Do you have a mess of cables around your home? Donâ€™t worry, I do too. Hereâ€™s a simple solution that will improve your cable management immensely for a mere $4.99. Buy the Canisflax Magnetic Cable Clips for just $4.99 ($7 off)

items.title: Google confirms: Powerful Ask Photos editing tool is missing in some states
items.summary: Google confirms that conversational editing is blocked in these states.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Googleâ€™s conversational photo editing tool is missing for users in Texas and Illinois. A PR representative for the company has confirmed that the feature is currently unavailable for users in these states. The reason could be due to the biometric data laws in Texas and Illinois. When Google launched the Pixel 10 series, it also debuted a conversational editing feature for the Photos app. Conversational editing is a Gemini-powered feature that allows you to edit images simply by entering a text or voice prompt. Last month, Google expanded the feature so other Android users in the US could begin trying it out. Although itâ€™s now available on more Android devices, itâ€™s still missing for users in two states. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: No Maccabi Tel Aviv fans allowed at Villa match
items.summary: Aston Villa confirm no away fans will be permitted to attend the Europa League match at Villa Park against Maccabi Tel Aviv in November.

items.title: Harrowing home invasion footage reminds us to check for unknown Bluetooth trackers
items.summary: AirTag tracking let crooks follow this couple home â€” Don't let it happen to you!
items.body: TL;DR A Florida couple was subjected to a home invasion this past August. Afterwards, detectives found an AirTag secured under their car, presumably used to track them home. Android offers built-in unknown tracker detection for users interested in protecting themselves. Oh, paranoia! Everyoneâ€™s always â€œrelax, donâ€™t worry so muchâ€ until something happens to them . And if weâ€™ve got access to the tools that might prevent those bad things from happening in the first place, shouldnâ€™t we remember to be using them? Thatâ€™s exactly what weâ€™re thinking about this week, as we get an update on a scary home invasion case that appears to have involved tracking the victims via AirTag. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

OxygenOS 16 is now official, and OnePlus has finally shared when the update will reach its phones and tablets. The rollout begins next month, bringing the companyâ€™s latest software, based on Android 16 , to a range of models. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Wallet is finally getting a home for your Play Points

items.body: TL;DR The Google Play Store has implemented a Play Points loyalty system for earning discounts. So far, youâ€™ve managed your Play Points directly through the Play Store app. Now Google Wallet has started giving users the option to add Play Points as a loyalty card. Google Wallet is far more than just a place to keep your credit cards, and the app has evolved into a digital card hub thatâ€™s truly worthy of its name, carrying everything from travel passes to loyalty cards. That latter addition is one weâ€™ve seen the app been giving some special attention to this year, building out tools to help you keep them current and surface the right one at the right time . Now weâ€™re learning about the latest loyalty card perk coming to Wallet, as the app begins supporting Google Play Points. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Have a legacy T-Mobile plan? You may qualify for this $830 â€˜any conditionâ€™ trade-in credit
items.summary: Are you eligible? Read on to find out.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is reportedly running a new $830 â€œany conditionâ€ trade-in offer (Promo R339) that began on October 2 and includes many older Android and iPhone models. The promo seems targeted mainly at legacy Simple Choice users, giving older plan holders a rare chance to qualify for a major deal. Unfortunately, it isnâ€™t listed in the T-Life app for most users, and must be confirmed through a rep (call or text 611). T-Mobile might offer a wide range of phone deals and promotions, but most of the time, there are clear restrictions on who is eligible. Some deals require a higher-end plan to qualify, but nearly every offer requires at least a current entry-level plan. This usually means customers with older, legacy plans are left out in the dark. Thankfully, every once in a while, an offer comes along that even older plans like Simple Choice can take advantage of. According to several users on Reddit , some have been able to get in on a new $830 â€œany conditionâ€ trade-in offer.

items.title: Two of your favorite streamers just announced a bundle that could save you money (Updated)

items.body: TL;DR NBCUâ€™s Peacock app now includes code referencing a still-unannounced Apple TV Plus bundle deal. While pricing is not yet available, the app promises savings over separate subscriptions. Users will have to manually cancel their existing subscriptions first if signed up through third parties. Update, October 16, 2025 (12:11 PM ET): We saw this one coming a couple weeks ago, and today Apple and NBCUniversal are making the bundle official: Starting October 20, youâ€™ll be able to subscribe to both Apple TV and Peacock Premium for just about $15 a month, or Apple TV and Peacock Premium Plus for $20. Original article, October 3, 2025 (11:04 AM ET): Youâ€™d be forgiven for wincing a little anytime you see the name of one of your favorite streaming services pop in a news feed, as how often is it good news? If itâ€™s not upcoming shows being shelved over fears of upsetting just the worst people, itâ€™s news of price hike after price hike driving up your monthly bills. Today weâ€™d love to break from that pattern with some actual good news â€” even if we donâ€™t quite have all the salient details just yet.

items.title: Google Photos will make your life look more feed-friendly with new highlight templates
items.summary: It'll be easier than ever to make flashy highlight reels from your own content.
items.body: TL;DR Weâ€™ve seen evidence that Google Photos is getting new templates for highlight videos. The templates include pre-selected captions and music. Templates arenâ€™t available yet, but could roll out soon. Google Photos is picking up some new tricks to make it easier to create more expressive highlight videos. The app can already splice together clips around a certain theme to make short-form videos about your own life, and now, weâ€™ve found evidence that that capability is expanding. Experimenting with version 7.50 of the Google Photos app on Android, we managed to enable an updated version of the highlight video editor. This new iteration comes with a bunch of new templates that include pre-selected music, as well as the option to add custom text overlays.

items.title: OnePlusâ€™s big OxygenOS 16 update brings much more than just Android 16: Hereâ€™s everything new
items.summary: OxygenOS 16 is based on Googleâ€™s Android 16 release, but OnePlus added a ton of new features on top.
items.body: When Google released Android 16 this past June, many users were disappointed by its lack of new features. Fortunately, the open nature of Android allows OEMs like OnePlus to add their own changes on top of Googleâ€™s releases. Thatâ€™s exactly what OnePlus has done with its latest OxygenOS 16 update. It not only brings many of Android 16â€™s key features to OnePlus phones but also adds a host of additional features to improve your productivity, touch up your photos, make your phone feel faster, and more. Hereâ€™s everything new in OxygenOS 16! A new look and feel for OnePlus phones in OxygenOS 16 The biggest change in OxygenOS 16 is the new design. While not as extensive as Googleâ€™s Material 3 Expressive overhaul in Android 16, OxygenOS 16 is still a significant refresh. OnePlus divided the design changes into two categories: â€œBreathe With Youâ€ for visual refinements and â€œThrive with Free Expressionâ€ for new customization options.

items.title: Miss your Xperia Play? You need to see this magnetic sliding Bluetooth controller
items.summary: This viral Kickstarter controller is finally out of crowdfunding, and it looks incredible.
items.body: Credit: Ohsnap TL;DR MCON, a unique sliding mobile controller that attaches via magnets, is now available for purchase. It features TMR sticks, analog triggers, gyro controls, flip-out handles, an optional dock for external displays, and more. Initially funded via Kickstarter, it will be available later today to pre-order for $149.99 on the Ohsnap website. Mobile controllers have become more popular over the years as more controller-compatible Android games, emulators, and cloud gaming applications have hit the market. Most are simple telescopic controllers, but MCON is the first option in years with an entirely new design. With a look that harkens back to sliding handhelds like the PSP Go, Xperia Play, or even the recent ANBERNIC RG Slide , MCON attaches to the back of your phone via MagSafe magnets, then slides out with a spring-loaded â€œswitchbladeâ€ mechanism in the back. This allows it to tuck away neatly when not in use, while still providing full-size controls when you need them.

items.title: Poll: Was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge?
items.summary: Is five months enough time to judge the success of a new flagship phone line?
items.body: Samsung took a swing at the thin-and-light smartphones category with the Galaxy S25 Edge , releasing the phone before Apple could release the iPhone Air . Shockingly, mere five months after its launch, reports suggest that Samsung has killed the Edge line . That means no further production of the Galaxy S25 Edge beyond existing stock, and no plans to launch its successor, the Galaxy S26 Edge. One can argue that five months is too short a period to judge the performance of a phone line. So, was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge? Reports suggest that the Galaxy S25 Edge sold only 1.31 million units since its launch in May, up to August. The first three months after launch are where most smartphone sales are concentrated, so this was seemingly enough of a runway for Samsung to assess the S25 Edgeâ€™s sales performance. In contrast, the Galaxy S25, S25 Plus, and S25 Ultra sold 8.28 million, 5.05 million, and 12.18 million units, respectively, as of August. Even the lowest-selling S25 Plus sold many times more than the Edge, but with the advantage of having launched earlier in the year.

items.title: Hate your phoneâ€™s camera island design? This flagship lets you swap it out like Lego

items.body: Credit: Realme TL;DR Realme just teased a key design element for the upcoming GT 8 Pro flagship. Its camera island can be swapped out for a different shape or color. The phone also features special color tuning by camera brand Ricoh and is realmeâ€™s first phone with a special partnership. Innovation is dead, one could easily argue in the context of phone designs. In addition to the glass slab becoming widely accepted as the standard design for a big chunk of smartphones made and sold today, the fast lane launches and the constant battle to uproot competition have led manufacturers to focus on other areas than design. At the same time, certain outliers, like Nothing, challenge that notion by experimenting with unusual camera designs , secondary displays , and unusually tiny screens . Now, another leading Android manufacturer is experimenting with a subtle change that can radically alter the phoneâ€™s look by altering how the camera appears. OnePlusâ€™ sister brand, realme, has just begun teasing its upcoming flagship with a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 . In addition to the new chipset, the realme GT 8 Pro is also the brandâ€™s first phone to feature a camera developed in partnership with a caâ€¦

items.title: Thanks Hasselblad: These 15 photos might be the best Iâ€™ve ever taken with a phone
items.summary: Can the OPPO Find X9 Pro beat Apple and Google for title of best camera phone?
items.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kfZRRrBe9Qk This week, weâ€™ve spent some hands-on time with the upcoming OPPO Find X9 Pro flagship. It wonâ€™t be long until we can share our full initial impressions, but we can talk a bit about the new camera setup, and itâ€™s certainly shaping up to be impressive. Thatâ€™s not particularly surprising. I highly rate the Find X8 Pro â€” my current daily driver â€” in no small part for its stunning pictures. But OPPO plans to take things up a gear this year with a new 200-megapixel telephoto camera, co-developed with Hasselblad once again. The company also has a Hasselblad telephoto extender lens that takes the 200MP cameraâ€™s 3.3x zoom / 70mm focal length and blasts it up to a longer-range 9.6x zoom with an equivalent 230mm focal length. Paired with crops and upscaling from that huge 200MP camera, it can take photos all the way out to 40x (920mm).

items.title: I tested the zoom cameras on the Pixel 10 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro, and Google should be worried

items.body: Iâ€™m not quite ready to draw my conclusions on the iPhone 17 Pro just yet â€” essentially, whether it can finally pull me away from Android â€” but I do know one thing: Apple is taking its still photography more seriously than ever. Itâ€™s added new Photographic Styles to the mix, reworked the camera app to give it a more straightforward interface, and finally upgraded its camera hardware with a significantly improved 4x telephoto sensor . Unsurprisingly, it has me reaching for the iPhone camera more than ever before, and itâ€™s making me wonder whether the Pixel 10 Pro really has my favorite camera system. So, to settle things once and for all, I decided to put the two giants to the test. I set out to grab a series of snaps across some of the most common focal lengths to see if I really still liked Googleâ€™s processing the best. Hereâ€™s what I found.

items.title: Forget the Analogue 3D, this competing N64 FPGA console is ready for the spotlight
items.summary: The ModRetro M64 will be on display and fully playable for the public this weekend.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR The ModRetro M64 will be playable this weekend at the Portland Retro Gaming Expo. The modern N64 FPGA device plays original N64 cartridges, plus many more via MiSTer cores. It may beat the Analogue 3D out of the gate, despite being announced more than a year later. The N64 is making a comeback, with two separate FPGA consoles set to arrive soon. The most recent contender, the ModRetro M64, will be playable for the first time at this weekendâ€™s Portland Retro Gaming Expo. Announced via X , this will be the first official look at the M64 hardware. Several key details have been revealed over the past few months, including the fact that it will be capable of running MiSTer cores to emulate other consoles, but the physical hardware design is still a mystery. The announcement includes an illustration of the console, which looks fairly faithful to the original hardware.

The new Google Search app experiment on Windows looks like a one-stop solution for anyone more invested in Googleâ€™s ecosystem than Microsoftâ€™s Copilot efforts. And seeing it in action as a Mac user, I donâ€™t want to admit it, but Iâ€™m a bit jealous. Sure, Apple has Spotlight, but itâ€™s still light on AI and lacks the best of what Google Search offers â€” the features I actually use every single day.

items.title: Nothing reveals the shocking cost of building a custom smartphone OS
items.summary: It's more than what the hardware of a flagship phone costs.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Nothingâ€™s latest video with MrWhoseTheBoss breaks down what it really costs to build a smartphone OS from scratch. The team estimates a total cost of $40.47 million, higher than the approximate $26 million needed for flagship hardware. By using AOSP instead of starting from zero, Nothing saves time, money, and gains full access to Googleâ€™s ecosystem. Ever wondered what it takes to build a custom operating system from scratch? In its latest collaboration with YouTuber MrWhoseTheBoss, Nothing takes a closer look at what it truly costs to build a new operating system from the ground up. The video, which aimed to create a custom OS for Arun Maini, breaks down every stage of the process, from planning to deployment, and reveals that developing a fully functional mobile OS would cost an eye-watering $40.47 million. As the video highlights, that figure is even higher than the estimated $26 million it would take to produce the hardware of a flagship phone, as shown in the duoâ€™s earlier Dream Phone project .

Samsung took a giant leap of faith with the Galaxy S25 Edge , a flagship smartphone that was ready to compromise on some core specifications in the pursuit of a thin and light body. The Korean company one-upped Apple before it could launch the iPhone Air , and even several other Android OEMs before they could jump onto the thin-and-light bandwagon. However, itâ€™s no surprise that the Galaxy S25 Edge isnâ€™t selling well, and the latest report out of South Korea indicates that Samsung has already canceled its successor, the Galaxy S26 Edge. It packs a 5,000mAh battery, a triple-rear camera setup, 16GB of RAM, and a MediaTek chipset. Thereâ€™s a lot of talk about de-Googling these days. The movement essentially advocates cutting Googleâ€™s access to private information on peopleâ€™s devices. Thatâ€™s why many privacy-focused operating systems, like GrapheneOS , are gaining traction among users who want to avoid Googleâ€™s tracking and data collection and protect their information from reaching the wrong hands. Now, a new smartphone called the HIROH Phone is promising all those things, and it even adds a hardware kill switch for extra peace of mind.

items.title: Amazon admits its color Kindles arenâ€™t the best option for bookworms
items.summary: The candid disclaimer points out that black-and-white Kindle models deliver a sharper reading experience.
items.body: Credit: Amazon TL;DR Amazon updated its Kindle Colorsoft FAQs with a candid disclaimer. The company says that black-and-white Kindles, like the Paperwhite, offer crisper text. Colorsoft screens still suit comics and PDFs, but trade sharpness for color. Color E-Ink might be all the rage these days thanks to the Kindle Colorsoft lineup, but even Amazon is admitting thereâ€™s a trade-off. The company has updated its product FAQs to note that while its Colorsoft screens deliver a â€œhigh-quality reading and writing experience,â€ the black-and-white Kindles, such as the Paperwhite and Scribe, still offer slightly crisper text. As spotted by Good e-Reader , Amazon added near-identical wording to the FAQ pages for both the new Kindle Scribe Colorsoft and the cheaper 16GB Colorsoft model . The company explains that the color layer responsible for bringing illustrations to life also changes the screenâ€™s texture and brightness. If youâ€™re after the sharpest black-and-white reading experience, Amazon suggests checking out its monochrome Kindles instead.

Pixel users can expect features like auto-themed app icons, an expanded dark theme, icon shape customization, and much more. Since QPR2 is going to be a big update, Google is working to ensure it doesnâ€™t bring a ton of new bugs, so the company rolled out a new beta today to find and fix them before release. Google rolled out Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 earlier today to all supported Pixel devices, from the Pixel 6 series to the new Pixel 10 series. In terms of changes, the update doesnâ€™t bring as many new features as QPR2 Beta 1 or QPR2 Beta 2 , but it does still fix a ton of bugs and introduces a new security patch level.

items.title: Android 16 QPR2 brings Live Updates to the Android Easter egg
items.summary: The Android Easter egg now shows a status bar chip indicating the progress of the spaceship to its next destination.
items.body: TL;DR Google is updating the Android Easter egg in Android 16 QPR2 to properly showcase the new Live Updates feature. Live Updates allow apps to provide persistent progress updates in the status bar, on the always-on display, and at the top of the notification panel. The feature wasnâ€™t fully ready in Android 16â€™s initial release, which is why the Easter egg is only now being updated to support it. One of the biggest new features in Android 16 is Live Updates. Live Updates are basically Androidâ€™s version of iOSâ€™ Live Activities, and they allow you to quickly get progress updates from applications without stopping whatever youâ€™re doing. For example, a navigation app could use Live Updates to show your next turn in a status bar chip, or a food delivery app could use it to tell you that your food is about to be dropped off. Thereâ€™s a lot of potential ways that apps can use the Live Updates feature, but unfortunately, developers had to wait a bit to actually use it. Thatâ€™s because the Live Updates feature wasnâ€™t ready until last monthâ€™s Android 16 QPR1 release , which added full support for it. The initial release of Android 16, in contrast, just added support for the new progress-centâ€¦

items.title: Nothing Phone 3a users in the dark over Glyph light glitch
items.summary: Multiple users report a recurring Glyph light bug following the latest update.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Pro owners report a Glyph light that gets stuck on after the September update. Restarting the phone clears the issue, but it often returns. Thereâ€™s no official fix yet, although one user was informed that a software update is being developed. Nothingâ€™s signature Glyph lights are meant to be a handy visual accompaniment, but some Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Pro owners say theyâ€™re now refusing to turn off. Following the September update, multiple users have reported a persistent light that only disappears after rebooting the device. Across several Reddit threads, such as this one , this one , and this one , affected owners describe the same behavior: a main Glyph segment suddenly turns on and stays lit, ignoring normal controls in settings. A few users say it started after using the Essential Recorder feature, while others noticed it appearing without warning during calls or at a specific time of day. Restarting the phone clears it, but only temporarily.

items.title: Nothing blames Apple patents for the lack of more phones with magnets for wireless charging
items.summary: Patents and red tape make for a lousy wireless charging landscape.
items.body: TL;DR Very few Android phones feature built-in magnets for wireless charging, while many more require a case with magnets. According to Nothing, patent restrictions prevent Android manufacturers from making phones optimally compatible with MagSafe. A company trying to develop its own compatible magnetic system could expect to invest $10M or more. Years and years after smartphones first started supporting it, wireless charging is having a moment. And itâ€™s all Appleâ€™s Qi2â€™s fault. At least, while weâ€™ve been able to drop phones on charging mats for ages, the convenience and efficiency of magnet-aligned wireless charging has only really taken off with the introduction of MagSafe accessories â€” and now with the arrival of Qi2 25W, Android devices are finally starting to get in on the action. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

Bitmoji will still be accessible generally from its website and in other apps. Gboard provides quick access to GIFs and stickers to easily attach them in any app that allows it. One of the types of stickers the app currently supports is Bitmoji, little customizable cartoons that you can make look like yourself, right down to clothes and accessories. That integration wonâ€™t be around much longer, though. Earlier this year, we spotted code in the Gboard app that made it seem like Bitmoji support would be phased out before 2026. That change is drawing near: The app is now showing users a warning that clearly says Gboardâ€™s Bitmoji integration is ending in just a few weeks.

items.title: Survey shows how many of you are still holding out hope for Google Home
items.summary: Your votes in our poll reveal how much patience is left for the smart home ecosystem.
items.body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority A smart speakerâ€™s supposed to make life easier rather than drive you up the wall, but thatâ€™s what many Google Home owners have experienced over the past few years. Various glitches and broken routines have tested peopleâ€™s patience, even among those whoâ€™ve stuck by the platform from the start. Googleâ€™s hoping its big Gemini for Home upgrade and new hardware will turn things around, but after so many false starts, we wanted to know if people are willing to wait around for that revival. We polled our readers to find out. My colleague Karandeep Singh expressed his personal views on this recently, making his article the perfect place to run our poll. For his part, he admitted his loyalty to Google Home had finally run out. He explained how years of reliability issues and patchy updates had worn him down, and how learning that Gemini for Home wonâ€™t launch in India anytime soon was the final straw. Understandable as that is, his geospecific issue wonâ€™t apply to many of our readers, and the poll results below suggest that a majority of you are willing to roll the dice with Googleâ€™s smart home ecosystem at least one more time.

items.title: Samsungâ€™s new Qi2 chargers are ready before its phones are
items.summary: Two Qi2-certified wireless chargers for home and car, but you'll still need a magnetic case for the full experience.
items.body: Credit: Samsung TL;DR Samsung has launched two new Qi2-certified wireless chargers in the US, one for home use and one for the car. The Single Wireless Charger costs $34.99, while the Car Wireless Charger is $84.99. The chargers work with the latest Samsung flagships, but youâ€™ll need a magnetic case for the full Qi2 experience. Samsung just rolled out a pair of Qi2 wireless chargers in the US, bringing some significant upgrades to the line for 2025. The new Single Wireless Charger and Car Wireless Charger are both Qi2-certified and designed to work with Samsungâ€™s latest flagships, provided you use a compatible magnetic case for the whole Qi2 experience. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Icon, trailblazer & Wales hero - Fishlock's seismic legacy

items.title: Retiring Fishlock's best Wales goals
items.summary: Look back at some of the best goals the retiring midfielder has scored for her country.

items.title: Your open-source custom ROM has a dirty secret, and Librephone wants to fix it
items.summary: New FSF effort could finally bring true privacy transparency to smartphones.
items.body: TL;DR Librephone is an effort to reverse engineer proprietary code needed for your phone to run. While projects like LineageOS prioritize open-source code, some binary â€œblobsâ€ have so far been necessary. The project will start by identifying a target handset with minimal proprietary code. Privacy is a big concern for a lot of smartphone users, and while platforms like Android offer oodles of different settings for managing your data and who gets access to it , at the end of the day youâ€™re still placing your trust in Google. Youâ€™ve got other options, though, with projects like GrapheneOS offering alternative firmware that doubles down on privacy while further minimizing your dataâ€™s exposure. And now weâ€™re learning about a new effort that looks to address one of the biggest issues with open software projects like that. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: What does xG tell us about how Premier League teams have started the season?
items.summary: The Premier League table is starting to take shape and while results are obviously what matter most, they don't tell the whole story.

items.title: T-Mobileâ€™s JUMP! On Demand program is shutting down, but thereâ€™s a silver lining
items.summary: Customers get one final upgrade before December 1.
items.body: TL;DR T-Mobile is ending its JUMP! On Demand lease plans on December 1. Existing subscribers can upgrade one final time through November 30. JOD subscribers will keep whichever phone theyâ€™re currently leasing when the program ends, at no additional cost. T-Mobile is no longer taking new JOD sign-ups, so this perk is only for established customers. T-Mobile launched a program branded JUMP! On Demand (JOD) back in 2015. JOD is a lease plan that allowed subscribers to swap their leased devices out as frequently as once a month â€” an appealing proposition for folks who want to try out all the latest phones without spending thousands of dollars a year to do it. T-Mobile has announced that that plan is going away in a few weeks, but itâ€™s offering subscribers a pretty decent consolation. As spotted by The Mobile Report , T-Mobile is ending the JOD program on December 1. But as T-Mobile spells out in support documentation, existing JOD subscribers will get to keep their current device when the plan goes away. The carrier will even waive any remaining lease payments.

items.title: Mint Mobile now offers home internet service, but is it any good?
items.summary: The answer to that will likely depend on how much the $60 a year savings matter to you.
items.body: TL;DR Mint Mobile has officially launched MINTernet, a 5G home internet service using the same technology as T-Mobile 5G Home Internet, starting at $30 per month. The $30 rate requires a Mint Mobile voice line and upfront payments: $90 for the first 90 days, then $360 for the following year; without Mint, the cost is $40 per month with annual prepayment. MINTernet offers unlimited data and saves about $60 per year compared to T-Mobileâ€™s service, though monthly payments arenâ€™t available, and its network priority is unclear. Late last month, Mint Mobile dropped the first hints about its new home internet service , but today itâ€™s finally official. MINTernet starts at just $30 a month and is based on the same technology as T-Mobile 5G Home Internet.

items.title: Android tablets stand no chance against the new iPad Pro with M5
items.summary: The iPad Pro with M4 already beats the most powerful Android tablets, and the M5 refresh widens the gap even further.
items.body: TL;DR The new iPad Pro features the M5 chip, a more powerful processor that offers up to 15% faster CPU performance and 4 times the peak GPU compute performance. The updated tablet also gets new wireless chips for Wi-Fi 7 and improved cellular connectivity. The iPad Pro with M5 is now available for pre-order, starting at the same price as the previous model. Apple launched the iPhone 17 series last month, and the company is back this month to launch a refresh of the iPad Pro, now with the newer and more powerful M5 processor, alongside Appleâ€™s N1 and C1X chips. Thanks to these upgrades, Apple is doubling down on performance on the most powerful iPad. Android tablets could barely compete with the iPad Pro in terms of pure performance, and with this upgrade, it doesnâ€™t look like any of them stand a chance of usurping the throne. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Whatâ€™s worse than ads on your TV? Ads on your TV featuring you
items.summary: You can now sell yourself some products but not make any money from it
items.body: Credit: Glance AI TL;DR DirecTVâ€™s Gemini streaming devices will soon show you AI-generated ads featuring your face. It is partnering with Glance, which will use your face to create AI avatars featuring shoppable products, similar to Googleâ€™s try-on shopping feature. Glance also powers lockscreen ads on phones from major brands. The best way for most TV manufacturers to extract value from consumers is to display ads. So why not take it up a notch with personalized targeting? Or take it a step further by showing your digital clones on-screen to sell suitable products? Thatâ€™s exactly what the US-based streaming hardware and service provider DirecTV aims to do with its latest development. DirecTV recently revealed its plans to use AI to display screensaver ads. Not stopping there, the provider is also planning to create AI-generated avatars of you , your family, and even your pets. In a fashion similar to Googleâ€™s virtual try-on Shopping feature , DirecTVâ€™s AI will dress you in fancy clothing or surround you with products to woo you into buying them.

items.title: This might be my favorite lock screen feature on Android right now
items.summary: It's not the most practical feature in the world, but this lock screen wallpaper trick is fun to use nonetheless.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Vivoâ€™s newly launched OriginOS 6 skin for global users has a fun lock screen wallpaper feature called Flip Cards. This feature lets you tilt your phone to smoothly switch between one of several pre-selected lock screen wallpapers. Flip Cards also comes after Xiaomi introduced its fun Dynamic Wallpapers feature earlier this year. It seems like all the major Android phone manufacturers are paying attention to lock screen customization once again, and vivo is no exception. In fact, the companyâ€™s latest Android skin has one particular lock screen trick that Iâ€™d like to see on phones from other brands. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Roku TV is getting a big Voice upgrade, new sports features, and a whole lot more
items.summary: This fall is just packed with new tools and upgrades for your Roku TV device.
items.body: TL;DR Roku is bringing new discovery, sports, and search tools to its TV platform. Roku Voice scores an AI upgrade that can answer questions about the content youâ€™re watching. The Roku Mobile app is gaining new shortcuts for some of its most-used features. Just because weâ€™ve got Android in our name doesnâ€™t mean weâ€™re beholden to Googleâ€™s media platform, and our interests touch on everything from Apple TV to the latest news from Roku . We just saw Roku TV expand to projectors last month, and now weâ€™re already getting an update there, as well as a look at all the other new additions coming to Roku devices. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: New Google Messages features make it harder for scammers to fool you
items.summary: Get ready to scan some QR codes.
items.body: TL;DR Key Verifier, a feature meant to confirm messages are coming from the person you think they are, is now live in Google Messages. The tool generates per-device QR codes that you and your contacts can scan to verify unique device keys. Google also mentions that links in texts marked as spam are now automatically blocked. Scams are everywhere in digital life, from phishing emails to â€œwrong numberâ€ texts to voicemails about nonexistent large purchases supposedly charged to your credit card. Ideally, you should be looking critically at any communication from sources youâ€™re not familiar with, but scammers are getting sophisticated, and a little help spotting a suspicious message can go a long way. Today, Googleâ€™s highlighting a couple of recent Messages features that should help keep you (and your less savvy family members) out of hot water. The more interesting anti-scam feature Google is calling attention to is Key Verifier. Initially announced last year and further detailed in May, Key Verifier adds an extra layer of security that helps ensure messages are actually coming from the person you think they are, rather than a bad actor who may have gained access to their phone numbeâ€¦

items.title: Recovering your Google account after a hack is going to become much less of a headache
items.summary: Google's new recovery tools will make getting your account back much easier.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google is rolling out two new ways to recover your account after you lose access. â€œRecovery Contactsâ€ lets you pick trusted friends and family to verify your identity. Users will soon be able to use their mobile number and lock screen passcode to sign in. The thought of losing access to your Google account for whatever reason is bad enough. But being unable to recover that account would be even worse. To make account recovery less of a pain in the neck, Google is rolling out new account recovery tools. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: So it begins: This OEM is embracing iOS 26-like design for its global Android 16 update
items.summary: The good news is that OriginOS is coming to global vivo phones. The bad news is that it's got some iOS-like aesthetics.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR vivo has launched OriginOS 6 for global consumers, replacing the Fun Touch OS skin. This Android 16-based update also brings an iOS-like aesthetic along with Mac integration and a neat Flip Cards feature. The beta program is currently available on the X200 Pro and Iqoo 13. Vivo has long offered two distinct Android skins for its phones, as China gets OriginOS and global users receive Fun Touch OS. Some fans have long asked vivo to bring OriginOS to global markets, and the manufacturer has now done just that. Sort of. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.summary: Here is a weekly selection of Android wallpapers created by our readers and members of the Android Authority team!
items.body: Welcome to Wallpaper Wednesday! In this weekly roundup, weâ€™ll give you a handful of Android wallpapers you can download and use on your phone, tablet, or even your laptop/PC. The images will come from folks here at Android Authority as well as our readers. All are free to use and come without watermarks. File formats are JPG and PNG, and weâ€™ll provide images in both landscape and portrait modes, so theyâ€™ll be optimized for various screens. For the newest walls as well as all the ones from previous weeks, check out this Drive link . Want to submit your own? Head to the bottom of this article. Head to the bottom of this article to find out how you could have one of your images featured in an upcoming Wallpaper Wednesday!

items.title: Two big reasons why I wonâ€™t buy a new charger for my Pixel 10 Pro XL
items.summary: $60 to shave less than five minutes off the charge time? No thanks.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Picking out the best wall charger for the new Google Pixel 10 Pro XL is not the easiest task, thanks to some quite specific power requirements. Even then, I wasnâ€™t too impressed when testing out Googleâ€™s new 67W plug â€” partly because of some aggressive power throttling to prevent the phone from overheating. This made me wonder if I could just stick with an older adapter and receive pretty much the same charging experience. The thing is, the Pixel 10 Pro XLâ€™s higher 39W power limit is locked behind a rarer 20V PPS charging protocol requirement, meaning most customers are looking at buying (another!) new plug.

items.title: DJIâ€™s best mobile gimbal is being upgraded with 360Âº panning and other vital features
items.summary: Along with intelligent tracking for furry friends.
items.body: TL;DR DJI has announced a new Osmo Mobile gimbal with improved 360Âº panning and auto-tracking features. The new DJI Osmo Mobile 8 supports Apple DockKit, enabling subject-tracking features across various video and social media apps. Besides humans, it can now also track pets. DJI is easily one of the top names to crop up when youâ€™re looking for gimbals , and the brand is now rolling out an improved solution for phones. Less than a year after launching the Osmo Mobile 7 and 7P, DJI is introducing a successor with considerable improvements to panning and broader tracking support for apps that justify the update. The newly announced DJI Osmo Mobile 8 integrates or improves upon features from the more premium Osmo Mobile 7P . It now has the same compact profile as before, with an improved hand grip designed specifically for low-angle shots. With the updated model, DJI enhances panning, now supporting 360Âº rotation, which wasnâ€™t previously possible.

items.title: Motorolaâ€™s new ultra-thin phone challenges Samsung, Apple for the throne
items.summary: The new Moto X70 Air is ultra-thin at 5.99mm, but manages to cram a 4,800mAh battery and Snapdragon 7 Gen 4.
items.body: TL;DR Motorola has unveiled the Moto X70 Air, a super-slim smartphone with a thickness of 5.99 mm, powered by the Snapdragon 7 Gen 4 chip. It features a 4,800 mAh battery with 68W wired and 15W wireless charging support. The phone launches in China first, with a global debut expected soon as the Motorola Edge 70. The race to build ultra-thin smartphones is heating up, with brands like Samsung and Apple already pushing the limits through the Galaxy S25 Edge and iPhone Air . Now, Motorola has joined the fight with its latest contender: the Moto X70 Air. Officially unveiled in China just weeks after its first teaser, the X70 Air is one of the slimmest phones the company has ever produced. At only 5.99mm thick and weighing about 159g, it blends style with substance, packing a 4,800mAh battery, Snapdragon 7 Gen 4 chip, and triple 50MP cameras into a chassis thinner than most flagships. Although pricing has not been announced, the phone is already listed on Lenovoâ€™s official website , with a global debut expected under the â€œMotorola Edge 70â€ name. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google TV is working on a one-touch camera feed shortcut for your remote
items.summary: The customizable button on select Google TV remotes may soon be able to directly launch your camera feed.
items.body: TL;DR A future update for Google TV may let you program the customizable remote button to open a specific smart home camera feed directly. This would add a new shortcut option to the â€˜starâ€™ button, which can currently be set to launch an app, the input switcher, or the full smart home panel. Evidence for this unreleased feature was discovered in the code of the Google TV Ambient Mode app, though itâ€™s not yet live. When youâ€™re relaxing at home watching a show on your Google TV , interruptions are the last thing you want. Still, a package delivery or a strange sound outside can pull your attention away. Thatâ€™s why the customizable button on select Google TV remotes is so useful, as it can be configured to open the smart home panel , letting you view a camera feed or control other devices. A future update, however, may take this a step further by letting you bypass the panel to launch your preferred camera feed directly. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: I benchmarked the first Dimensity 9500 phone (Update: Re-tested)
items.summary: The vivo X300 and X300 Pro are the first phones with the next-generation Dimensity 9500 chip. So what about benchmarks?
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority Update: The original version of this article contained several issues with the testing method. We have rerun the tests and apologize for the oversight. vivo has just launched the X300 series , the first phones with MediaTekâ€™s new Dimensity 9500 processor. MediaTek promises some notable horsepower and efficiency gains for this chipset, but whatâ€™s it like in a real-world phone? I put our X300 Pro review unit through a series of benchmark tests, and the results are somewhat mixed.

items.title: The iPhone 18 Pro could finally adopt Samsungâ€™s old camera trick from the Galaxy S9
items.summary: The Galaxy S9 from 2018 sported variable aperture, but Samsung dropped the tech due to cost and thickness.
items.body: TL;DR The iPhone 18 Pro is reportedly getting a variable aperture main camera, a first for any iPhone. Variable aperture allows cameras to adjust their aperture size dynamically. This enables better low-light performance and sharper focus in good lighting conditions. Appleâ€™s move mirrors an approach pioneered by Samsung in the Galaxy S9 but abandoned afterward, although other Android brands have picked up the baton. The iPhone 17 series has been well-received by customers, and itâ€™s even enough to tempt many Android users into making the switch . Apple has made some meaningful upgrades to the iPhone 17 Proâ€™s cameras, but Android flagships, especially those from Chinese OEMs, show us that there is still room for significant improvement. It seems Apple is now taking a leaf out of Samsungâ€™s book for the iPhone 18 Pro next year, as it could upgrade the primary camera with a key tech that was first introduced with the Samsung Galaxy S9 in 2018! Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.summary: YouTube's new video player isn't winning everyone over. What do you think about the redesign? Take our poll and let us know.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority YouTube is once again rolling out sweeping UI changes, and this time, the video player is getting a major overhaul . Naturally, not everyone is welcoming the new look with open arms. In fact, the YouTube subreddit is filled with mixed reactions to the redesigned player, with many users calling it a big mistake.

items.title: Kobo made a $30 gadget for people who read burritoâ€™d in blankets
items.summary: Koboâ€™s new Remote proves laziness is the mother of invention.
items.body: TL;DR Kobo introduced its first handheld clicker for remote page turning. The Bluetooth-enabled Remote runs on a AAA battery and works up to 20m. It will be available for $29.99 starting November 4. Thereâ€™s a new must-have accessory for lazy (read: efficient) Kobo users. The company just announced its first-ever page turner, a simple, Bluetooth-powered clicker for readers who prefer to keep both hands buried under their blankets. Months ago, Kobo CEO Michael Tamblyn teased that a â€œlittle hardware surpriseâ€ was on the horizon, sparking speculation about what the company might be cooking up. Many Kobo fans guessed correctly that the use of â€œlittleâ€ pointed toward a new accessory, with the leading theory being a remote page turner. Now that itâ€™s official, Tamblyn describes the Kobo Remote as an invitation to â€œlounge deeperâ€ and read longer. In short, the remote offers users more flexibility in reading position.

items.title: This Android weather app is a must-have during the hurricane season
items.summary: Keep up to date with cyclones in the Atlantic, Pacific, and beyond.
items.body: Your favorite Android weather app probably meets your daily needs. It shows high and low temperatures, forecasts days in advance, and might even have cute widgets you can move around your home screen. However, standard weather apps often miss the mark when tracking tropical weather. Tropical storms are a seasonal concern for millions worldwide. Every year, from June through November, North Americans are on high alert for disturbances forming in the Atlantic. Although the 2025 Atlantic season has been unusually quiet, a powerful landfall canâ€™t be ruled out for the rest of the year. Therefore, itâ€™s crucial to have a quick way to check upcoming conditions. Traditional weather apps donâ€™t suffice, and thatâ€™s where my favorite seasonal weather app comes in.

items.title: Google Wallet now intuitively shows you the right pass at the right time
items.summary: Pulling up the right pass when you arrive at your destination.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is rolling out Nearby Pass, which shows a notification when youâ€™re near a transit station or event venue. The notification lets you access the pass directly without having to screen for the right card. Google is also expanding support for multiple similar cards through the same app. Google Wallet is much more than a payments app. It lets you neatly organize multiple different payments and membership cards, transit passes, event tickets, and much more. With a recent update , Google Wallet is gaining additional features to enhance your experience. For starters, Google is rolling out Nearby Pass geofence notifications in Wallet, first announced at Google I/O 2025 . This feature notifies users when theyâ€™re close to any location where one of their passes stored in Google Wallet could come in handy. For instance, these could be loyalty cards or vouchers for a retail store, a transit pass for the subway, the entry ticket to a concert, or something else.

items.title: The Pixel 10 Pro Foldâ€™s â€˜smoke showâ€™ hasnâ€™t broken my faith, but itâ€™s hanging by a thread
items.summary: Watching the Pixel 10 Pro Fold go up in smoke in JerryRigEverything's durability test has been painful to say the least.
items.body: Credit: YouTube Opinion post by Adamya Sharma When Google launched the Pixel 10 Pro Fold , I was genuinely impressed. Finally, a foldable phone with IP68 water and dust resistance, a first for the category. It felt like a landmark moment for foldable phones , with Google proving that the form factor could be as tough as traditional smartphones. I was even happy to overlook its slightly bulky frame and familiar design because the promise of durability seemed worth it .

items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
items.summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

items.title: Louis Theroux is here, there and everywhere!
items.summary: Back-to-back Louis Theroux documentaries opening your eyes to the hidden lives around you
